metadata.title: CVE-2019-12730 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
aa_read_header in libavformat/aadec.c in FFmpeg before 3.2.14 and 4.xbefore 4.1.4 does not check for sscanf failure and consequently allows useof uninitialized variables.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12730` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.1.4-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.1.4-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.1.4-1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.1.4-1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.1.4-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.1.4-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.1.4-1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.1.4-1
libavformat58 - 7:4.1.4-1
libavresample4 - 7:4.1.4-1
libavutil56 - 7:4.1.4-1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.1.4-1
libswresample3 - 7:4.1.4-1
libswscale5 - 7:4.1.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.1.4-1').
